info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Fulton County through 500 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Caroga Lake Public Campground, or near Gloversville, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Broadalbin, Mayfield, Cranberry Creek, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Caroga Lake, Perth, Berkshire, Bleecker, Meco, West Perth, Munsonville, Pinnacle, Broadalbin Junction, Tomantown, Hale Mills, North Broadalbin, Riceville and Bleecker Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
